title: So about 10 bans...
body: Any word on that for this next season? I believe it was Meddler who said that might happen, but I haven't seen anything talking about it either way.

replies.body: We're still planning to look into 10 bans once the new client's out (changes needed to champ select for extra bans would be made in that, not the old client). I think it's quite likely we move to a 10 ban system, though that's not guaranteed yet. Assuming we do go to 10 bans it's also possible Pro games and regular games might make the change at somewhat separated times (different workflows for draft matchmaking games versus tournament draft in custom games which is what Pro uses).

An idea. 30 seconds to declare a champ. 30 seconds for blue side to ban 5 (each player bans one, all ban at the same time), 30 seconds for red side to ban 5, then back to selecting champions as we already are. Champ select is actually shorter that way while incoorporating more bans. After we adjust, it'll be a breeze IMO.

We'll be looking into stuff like that (some issues with that exact approach, but the general direction is a promising one). Not increasing champ select time's probably going to be a starting requirement here, or at least very strong goal.

How about using Ban Intent. Similar to pick intent, but lets players queue up their bans.
Pull up champion window, Left click to put pick intent, right click for ban intent.
To make it potentially faster, could have Ban Intents banned automatically when it's that player's turn to lock the ban in (or even make it a toggle option).

We'll be assessing into solutions like that. First part of the process will be looking at different options (all up front? Bans mixed in with picks? Everyone at the same time? Bans selected before even getting to a game? etc). We'll then compare the costs and benefits of each model before we implement anything.
Yeah i really feel like bans before the lobby is even made is a bad idea. Would probably lead to a ton of unintentional bannings of what other people on your team wanted to play

If bans were to become a round robin thing like the picks then picks and bans would need to be unlocked as they are in tournament games. What I mean is that currently there is a definitive pick order. and that would need to be changed. For example when players 2 and 3 of blue team are picking; currently player 2 has to lock-in a champion before player 3 can even select one. While in tournament games players 2 and 3 can both hover / lock-in their champions at the same time. Should bans become round robin as well this would be a necessity to facilitate a smooth transition through champion select, and into the game. 

Realistically, short of allowing bans to be selected before even entering champion select there is no feasible solution in which you can allow each player 20-30 seconds to select their bans individually. At the same time champion select feels hurried as it is, so lowering that amount of time to 10-15 seconds would only feel bad for the players. 

Then there is integrating bans into the pick phase. There's two options with integrating bans into the pick phase, and both of them piggyback off of the lock-out I mentioned in the first paragraph. You can either have double round robin, or reverse double round robin. Double round robin obviously being that as champion select goes 1/2/2/2/2/1 each player would select a champion to ban before selecting their intended pick. Reverse double round robin being that each player would ban before the _enemy_ team picked their champions.

Overall, moving forward with a 10 ban system it seems absolutely crucial that the selection lock-out in non-tournament games be removed. If for no other reason than to shorten the amount of time transitioning through champion select, but there are also strategic pluses to it as well.

I mean, the most straightforward way to take care of it would be to basically piggyback on the existing champ select format (blue 1 / red 2 / blue 2 / red 2 / blue 2 / red 1), which has six time slots for picking. Current banning also has six time slots for picking as each individual picks one. You could implement an extra four bans without adding any extra time to champion select by just mimicking or mirroring the champ select process with the ban process. Perhaps something like: red 1 / blue 2 / red 2 / blue 2 / red 2 / blue 1.

Just a suggestion that I'm sure has already been kicked around by people smarter than i :)

Dark Rituals idea is a very smart idea @Meddler. 

_"How about using Ban Intent. Similar to pick intent, but lets players queue up their bans.
Pull up champion window, Left click to put pick intent, right click for ban intent.
To make it potentially faster, could have Ban Intents banned automatically when it's that player's turn to lock the ban in (or even make it a toggle option)."_

I will expand a little on this idea, discuss some problems and propose resolutions, and show how you could implement it into League of Legends for a quick and fair ban phase below...

So the idea is you could set yourself a ban list or maybe call it a "Champion Veto" (sounds more professional) and set a priority for the bans before jumping into a game of matchmaking. This can be either manual or automatic. Let's discuss automatic first...

An automatic implementation is this. Just make the client iterate through each player selecting each ban before the game starts until it's gotten through all the players for all of the bans that those players selected. 

For example... 

1. Player 1 (blue team), ban first priority.
2. Player 2 (red team), first priority is banned, so ban second priority, .etc. 

Now, this system might be problematic. There could be conflicts or the bans might not be representative of all the players "AS A TEAM" since players aren't able to discuss as a team what those bans should be before they pick them. In other words this system seems SoloQ oriented. The response is "Well then teams can't decide who to ban".

An automatic and manual ban phase could then look like this (for speed)... Output all of the teams 'preference bans' to the screen (ONLY THE PREFERENCE BANS NOT ALL CHAMPIONS), instead of beginning an automatic ban phase. Then give each player one ban, and then both teams select the bans they want simultaneously, and the client uses those bans. 

The only possible conflict there is players banning the same champion on one or more teams. This can be resolved by a standard Ban Phase (like the one we have now), until there are 5 bans on each side (one representing every player) or going back through to preference bans.

Sorted. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} World of options Meddler! Hope you ponder these ideas!

You understand that if a team bans 5 champions first simultaneously, the second team has a huge advantage, because they can ban after the enemy have already banned. (Indicating picks and maybe banning something the 2nd team wanted to ban)?

The variant we've talked about similar to that is simultaneous bans from all 10 players. You see what your team are banning/have banned, but not what the enemy is banning. Does lose the ability to shape your bans in response to the enemies, probably saves a lot of time though.
Have you guys thought about a system like DOTA2 where there are some bans, some picks, some more bans, and then the rest of the picks?

We've talked about it. There's some appeal certainly. Some good arguments for it in pro play in particular as a way to both support increased diversity and a more interesting champ select. Value in regular games seems lower given you don't know who your opponents are, so bans tend to be much more frustration, general power or lane counter based than specific.

Okay, thanks for the replay.

Would it be possible to have a separate pick/ban set up just for pro play as they have different needs, team comps, and metas than regular play?

It's something we're open to if it's the best solution. There is some value in consistency between the two, given the context's are pretty different might be outweighed by the advantages of tailoring a separate solution for each though.

There's certainly some value in casual play, for example if the enemy first picks Yasou the ban priority of Malphite and Alistar rises.

I also think there's just a value to keeping casual and competitive similar, so if there's a value in competitive and it's not detrimental to casual (I believe it's mildly positive) it may just be worth implementing for both.

I guess that would kill off many comps like Protect the Hyper carry and so on since (lets say) you picked kog and lulu and then they ban out janna/nunu... or whatever basically. I dont think that it will work in League!

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=99Oykczu,comment-id=0005000800020001,timestamp=2016-10-28T00:16:35.925+0000)
>
> The variant we've talked about similar to that is simultaneous bans from all 10 players. You see what your team are banning/have banned, but not what the enemy is banning. Does lose the ability to shape your bans in response to the enemies, probably saves a lot of time though.

Any kind of solution that allows all bans before picking is gonna hurt. For example, Yasuo mains will NEVER get to play the champ again at certain elo ranges. At my elo, Bronze/Silver Yasuo is permabanned. He still gets to see a bit of play but only because some people prefer to ban much stronger(or seemingly stronger) champions like Leblanc, Syndra, Xin, Darius etc and there aren't enough bans to ban them and Yasuo too. It's so bad, that it actually seems strange when people don't ban him. That is how often he is banned. If you allow 10 bans before any kind of picking, I'm 99.99% certain no one will ever get to play Yasuo again in low elo.

I'm no Yasuo player but I wouldn't like it if my favorite champ was permanently banned. This shouldn't be done to people who enjoy playing Yasuo. As much as we all hate playing against him, it's not fair to his fans.

> [{quoted}](name=lonof,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=99Oykczu,comment-id=000500080002000100060001,timestamp=2016-10-28T10:32:25.676+0000)
>
> Champions won't be banned like this anymore, well maybe at your elo. (it's good tho cuz you shouldn't play Yasou in bronze lol) It's just a waste of ban when your team doesn't have any tanks and is squishy as heck,you must ban someone with high burst or  some assasin but you ban Amumu because he is OP in current meta.

This is a very arrogant mindset. Just because Yasuo shouldn't be played in low elo, doesn't mean it's ok to allow him to be permabanned there. There is nothing wrong with Bronze people wanting to play him and it should not be denied on the basis of it being a terrible pick for low elo players. At the end of the day, people play to have fun and if Yasuo is fun for a lot of Bronze and Silver players, so be it. The game is for everyone, not just high elo players.

I agree.
and when people have their preferred champ banned that also increases the chance of dodgers, intentional feeders, and people having to just play a champ they might not be good at but have nothing else to use in that role.
What if people end up banning the same thing? e.g., Blue team bans jayce and then red team bans jayce? Or would one team get to go first then the other team gets to go?

> Or would one team get to go first then the other team gets to go?

They literally *just* discussed how bad that would be.

I really wish the pick&ban phase wont be made much longer with 10 total bans. Simultaneous bans would really help speed things up.

In theory red and blue side bans can happen simultaneously as well. I don't see a real problem in both teams occasionally banning the same champion. Means there sometimes could be just 9 or less bans. So what?
what about players that play 1 champ do you think that 10 bans will make Q time even more longer cause ppl gona leave if their main champ is baned??{{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:92}}
How about they get good at another champion?
People leave because they're "toxic" :>
rip yasuo
I'm definitely waiting for the day all ten players will ban all the diver class champions once that reaches live.

You laugh, but I got mastery 7 on AD Leona jungle stupidly easy. Nobody respects it, until you kill them before the cc even wears off. Blood razor, trinity force, the rest as needed.

Most common comment was: "wtf just happened" in all chat.
What are your runes and masteries and clear path? I've tried before, but the first clear is just so brutal.
Depression. Depression is what happened.
Now we will

I apologize if this has already been asked, but will you be changing the pick/ban phase when you change over to 10 bans?

For example, has there been any discussion regarding breaking up picks and bans rather than doing them all at once?

For example, each team:

* Ban 3
* Pick 3
* Ban 2 
* Pick 2

I don't know if anyone suggested this but I have a way do your bans. 
Blind Ban Phase:
     Each team collectively chooses 3 champions to ban
    (Several ways to implement the voting I have some ideas but wont explain them here)
    Bans can overlap between the two teams
    (Ex. Red -> Zed, Yi, Vi  | Blue -> Zed, Darius, Soraka => Final bans for the phase are Zed, Yi, Vi, Soraka, Darius)
Ordered Ban Phase:
     The remaining bans are chosen 2 per team in a 1-1-1-1 order or a 1-2-1
     (These bans can be assigned to a player or voted on by the team either works)

This banning system gives both teams a chance to ban out 3 champs that they don't want and their choices aren't affected by the other teams.
It also gives each team 2 more bans to react to the 3-6 bans that are done in the blind phase.
This lets a game have 7-10 bans which helps with the ever-growing champion pool.
An additional bans could be given in the ordered ban phase if the possible disparity in ban numbers isn't wanted
(Ex both teams ban the same 3 champs in blind phase, each team gets 1 more ban to bring the ban total up to 9)

I really like that you guys are considering more bans :)

Assuming 10 bans goes through, would you go through the entire ban phase first or would you shift between picks and bans?
Like: each side starts with X amount of champion bans, picks Y amount for their roster, then continues to ban Z amount until 10 bans are reached. 

I feel like if all 10 bans are made before you can even pick a champion, that you may be able to almost completely ban out a specific player or class of champion, which would make the entire process a bit jarring.

Im pretty sure it won't be "ban 10 champs first then pick champs" but more something like DOTA2 has (idk the pick system of Dota, but I think its smth like ban, pick 2, ban, pick last 3 or so). That's much better, because if for example the first 6 bans are junglers, you can still pick an okay-ish jungler before they are all banned

Please don't increase the bans. This will ruin the game for a lot of mains. Too many people just ban champions that they hate rather than using their bans strategically. Look at this Reddit thread if you haven't seen it already. 

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/59o7lm/if_there_was_1_champion_you_could_remove_from_the/

All these people calling for Yasuo to be removed from the game. Yasuo's ban rate has been so high for so long after his nerf just because there's not too many annoying OP champs right now. Imagine having 10 bans. People won't get to play Yasuo anymore. People will ban their own teammates out even just because they don't want to see them on that champ. The same goes for other hated champs like Zed and Riven. Bans are best used for banning OP champs. After that, people seem to more often ban champs they hate rather than banning their own counters. We don't need more than 6 bans for OP champs.

Edit: What maybe would be a good idea is keeping it at 6 bans for Solo Q and changing it to 10 bans for LCS and Flex Q to add more strategy to the ban phase.

I'm happy to hear this. I been plotting about this for months. My idea: 

1. allow each player to have 2 pre bans before entering the draft pick. As a result, this fix the issue of slowing down the ban process. Also, this wud be activated on the first two players, automatically in the draft. Taking one auto ban from each first two players. The other three players will pick thru the current draft ban. 

2. My second idea was making this system for high Elo players only. Why? Because lower elo wouldn't really need it. They lack alot of strategic. Especially in bronze. Plus, they are already busy learning many aspects of the game such as rotation, minion csing, plant system etc. Also low elo need more exposure to many different.  They need to learn way. Hints, more bannings for them doesn't help. This system would reward the serious players and assist them with having a healthier play and more strategic. Then again, you can add it to all elo as an experiment. 

Anyway,  I cant wait until this auto-ban draft picks is active.

Could you also adopt the [pick/ban system from Dota](http://dota2.gamepedia.com/Game_modes#Captains_Mode) (or something similar) for competitive? Makes for a bit more thought process in the draft instead of simply banning what you don't wanna play against.

Need to know for rules and requirements for participation. 

Thanks in advance!

Meddler please respond to this .. 
As a yasuo one trick main  in the current 6 ban system i rarely get to play yasuo .. now my fear is a 10 ban system would = 100% ban rate on my champ .. i know this might be not on your priority list but it hurts man .. the one system that seems nice to me is a mixed between picking and banning .. like on dota 2 .. and btw when a syndra and ryze more op but people still ban yasuo .. its not a balance thing ,, "Wohoooo 100% ban rate Yasuo, cant wait." this is taking from the comment section ..
Wohoooo 100% ban rate Yasuo, cant wait.
Have you considered 8 bans as sort of that perfect middle ground?

I think its best to just jump straight to ten.
My reasoning is that, we already have so many champs and they will continue to make more, 8 bans would be great now, but eventually there will be so many champs that we will have to go to ten. So might as well make the jump now than later. Plus it gives every player a ban.

I understand the idea of a 10 ban option for the non professional scene as well as for the professional. BUT have you considered what would happen when teams play vs SKT for example. I guarantee at least 4 of 5 bans will be midlainers, which means Faker will never again play Syndra Ryze Cassiopeia or Oriana. The same goes for every team who has a stand out star.
       Мaybе don't allow professional teams to pick the same champions in a row, and allow them one pick before the bans. This guarantees a diversity in champ selection and allows one pick of choice for the team.
        It's not a bad idea, think it trough and make it even better.
